Is it possible to bring a case to the supreme court that on one hand grants equal marriage rights to all, including gays, and on the other hand denies recognition of marriage to all. 
 
 For instance if the supreme court says that one state does not have to recognise marriages from another state then all from that state would be invalid in another state.
Matthew is parading the chip on his shoulder again everyone...

Matthew is parading the chip on his shoulder again everyone...

 
 I am serious could a state, for instance, bring a lawsuit against another state for not recognising some of its civil contracts? Could one state then pass laws that said that it will only recognise civil contracts from only those states that fully recognise theirs?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  a win win case.
